abstracts.cdata!:
Overall, the project outcome is
            satisfactory, and sustainability is likely. Lessons convey
            that operations with an integrated approach, supporting a
            reform program, may be somewhat ambitious, with complex
            implementation requirements. Thus, implementation of
            distinct phases of separate sub-sector reforms, each
            targeting its own set of priorities, is a more realistic
            approach to attain success, particularly under technical
            assistance lending. It is doubtful that without the added
            leverage of the structural adjustment program, and the
            railway concession to the Transport Sector Project, this
            operation would have achieved satisfactory results, and,
            furthermore, although the joint macro-micro approach proved
            effective, it is difficult to draw a line between the
            projects. The project proved that the budgetary, and social
            impact of privatization, including severance payments,
            should be addressed during project preparation, to set the
            pace for credible solutions. In light of the Bank's
            continuing decentralization efforts, the delegation of
            project management to the field need to be reviewed, for
            although positive overall, local pressures may force issues
            of particular local interest. It is suggested that, due to
            the political sensitivity to some reforms, such as the air
            transport reform, same could be more effectively discussed
            within a regional reform program.
